description: Ammunition for a Rifle. Loses velocity when fired over long distances resulting in slightly decreased damage.
A small 8x zoom scope.
Ammunition for a Shotgun.
Incendiary Shotgun Ammunition
Single large projectile for a Shotgun.
Ammunition for a 40mm Grenade Launcher.
Ammunition for a 40mm Grenade Launcher.
Ammunition for a 40mm Grenade Launcher.
A stupid barrel costume, so you can hide like a pro..p
A large wooden pool that can be filled with water.
A waterlogged assault rifle from the abyss
A divers suit found in the abyss, doubles as a reliable hazmat suit
Horizontal Abyss container taken from the depths of the ocean
Metal hatchet, reclaimed from the abyss, perfect for survival and crafting
Plucked from the abyss, this Metal Pickaxe is a prized possession for any survivor
Illuminate the underwater depths with this durable and waterproof diving torch
Vertical Abyss container taken from the depths of the ocean
A classic acoustic guitar, built for jam sessions around campfires at night.
An advanced tea that provides some hydration and temporarily increases your resistance to radiation a moderate amount.
An advanced cooling tea, provides hydration and temporarily decreases your max and core temperature.
An advanced crafting tea, provides hydration and temporarily increases the chances of a higher quality crafting outcome.
An advanced harvesting tea, provides hydration and temporarily boosts the amount of resources you receive from harvesting corpses a moderate amount.
An advanced healing tea, provides hydration and heals you a moderate amount over time.
An advanced health tea, provides hydration and temporarily boosts maximum health a moderate amount.
An advanced ore tea, provides hydration and temporarily increases your yield from ores a moderate amount.
A tea that removes some radiation.
An advanced scrap tea, temporarily increases the amount of scrap you receive from barrels a moderate amount.
An advanced warming tea that temporarily increases both your core and minimum temperature.
An advanced wood tea, temporarily increases the yield from cutting trees a moderate amount.
Receive a special gift each and every day!
A small bony fish commonly found in large schools.
A logic gate that allows electrical passthrough if BOTH inputs receives power, passthrough amount is the greater of either power source
Harvested from animals, combine with cloth to create a low quality fuel source.
Taking these pills will lower your radiation level. WARNING: May cause extreme dehydration.
An Apple. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
A delicious apple pie, always too hot. Provides a boost to hunger, health and hydration. Gives better night vision, including tree markings and ore hotspots, for a short time.
A hazmat suit made from radiation resistant rubber.
An arctic variant of the hazmat suit which trades radiation for cold protection.
Single module armored cockpit for a driver and one passenger.
Extremely strong door with a hatch to see and shoot out of.
Extremely strong door with a hatch to see and shoot out of.
Single module armored seating for two passengers.
Asbestos insert providing extra protection from heat for crafted clothes and armor.
High damage machine rifle.
A fairly solid helicopter with weapons capability.
A speaker which will emit a loud warning alarm when powered

This automated electric sentry turret will engage and neutralize any moving targets it has line of sight to. You must equip it with a projectile weapon and the corresponding ammunition. Note : The turret will search for targets in a 180 degree arc facing *you* when you place it. Requires 10 power.
A stationary ballista, perfect for defence. Can fire deadly bolts at distant targets.
Keep your things in this bamboo barrel. Stores up to 48 items. Cannot be locked.
Bamboo shelves for item stacking
Heal yourself or others with this bandage. Left-click heals you, right-click heals a target.
A square of cloth which is tied around the face over the nose and mouth.
A bandit guard suit
A wooden barricade with barbed wire, made of Wood and Metal Fragments. The barbed wire causes damage and will also slow player movement.
A makeshift Barbeque. You can cook significant amounts of food with this.
A baseball bat wrapped in barbed wire
Simple hat for your head. Offers basic protection from damage and the cold.
A basic tea that provides hydration and temporarily increases your resistance to radiation a small amount.
A basic cooling tea that temporarily decreases your max and core temperature.
A basic crafting tea. provides hydration and increases the chances of a higher quality crafting outcome for a short time.
A basic harvesting tea, provides hydration and temporarily increases the amount of resources you receive from harvesting corpses a small amount.
A basic healing tea, provides hydration and heals you a small amount over time.
Equipping these horse shoes will grant your horse additional movement speed
A basic health tea, provides hydration and temporarily boosts maximum health a small amount.
A basic ore tea, provides hydration and temporarily increases your yield from harvesting ores a small amount.
A basic scrap tea, temporarily increases the amount of scrap you receive from barrels a small amount.
A basic warming tea that temporarily increases both your core and minimum temperature.
A basic wood tea, temporarily increases the yield from cutting trees a small amount.
A small planter with enough room to plant 3 seeds.
A reinforced siege weapon built for smashing through wooden and stone constructions with brute force. Must be repaired with high quality metal to keep functioning.
A Battery.
The Beach Chair is the best way to relax, whether it's by the pool or on the beach.
A large umbrella that will shield you from the sun.
A small table to hold your drinks while relaxing.
A colourful beach towel. Placing this will give you a location to respawn.
An unreliable explosive grenade. Each one has a different length fuse, so you might lose some fingers. Can be used to make satchel charges.
A pie made of bear meat, provides a boost to hunger, health and hydration. Increases effect of harvesting teas but reduces their duration.
A Bed. Placing this will give you a place to respawn and can be used much more frequently than a sleeping bag. Note: Must be placed inside a building.
A bunch of Bee Grenades in a single catapult projectile. Creates swarms of Bees on impact.
A fragile glass jar full of bees. Breaking upon impact, the bees will find the nearest player to attack. Careful where you throw it!
Hand made beehive, place a nucleus inside to raise your own bees and produce honeycomb. Happy bees will make honeycomb more quickly.
The heart of any hive, needed for raising bees. Produce honeycomb from happy bees to grow the nucleus and increase yields.
A wooly hat, offering some basic protection from damage and cold for your head.
A pedal bike.
A pie made from jungle cat meat, purrfect temperature. Boosts hunger, health and hydration. Shows nearby animal tracks for a short time.
Binoculars allowing you to see objects at great length.
A very special and happy birthday to Rust!
A black berry.
A clipping of a Black Berry Plant.

These black berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food. Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.
Black Raspberries picked from berry bushes. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
A powerful oxidizing agent. Can be used as a disinfectant.
This object prevents passthrough while power is received through its second input.
Used in creation of medkits.
A blown weapon that fires darts with different effects.
Blueberries picked from berry bushes. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
A blue berry. Can be eaten or used in mixing table recipes to create teas.
A clipping of a Blue Berry Plant.

These blue berry seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food. Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more berries and faster growth.
A very large mortar type firework with a blue starburst
Blue Dog Tags
Blue ID Tag
A small blue light source.
A Blue Jumpsuit
A keycard with medium level clearance.
Blueprint
A small repeating firework, shoots a series of Blue balls into the air
A Shotgun with two barrels allowing two shots to be fired in quick succession before needing to reload.
A High powered, highly accurate, long range rifle.
A primitive suit of armor made of bones, weak protection from damage and the elements but better than nothing.
An Arrow equipped with a large bone arrowhead making it very easy to hit targets at the expense of damage
A blunt weapon made from a femur. All around basic gathering tool.
A basic damage dart.
Extracted from animal carcass. Used as a raw material to make bone weapons and armour.
A primitive helmet made from bone. Moderate protection from projectiles and melee damage.
Melee weapon crafted from bone fragments. Good for harvesting carcases.
Use the boogie board to catch some sick waves.
A large speaker to play recorded cassette tapes which can also stream audio from the internet. Open the settings to change audio options.
Can be used a melee weapon or as a throwable. Once thrown (with right click) it travels in an arc before coming back to you.
A boonie hat, offering minor protection from damage and cold for your head.
Sturdy work boots to keep your toes safe, you'd feel nothing if you kicked a table leg. Strong protection against the cold and incoming damage.
A canteen used to carry Water. Left click to drink, right click to fill from water sources, or to pour out.
A loaf of bread, eating it provides a boost to health, hunger and hydration. Feeding to a horse will provide a boost to its digestion and dung production for a short time.
Metal window bars made to fit a brick skin sized window.
A Bronze Egg. Open for a surprise or collect 10 to upgrade to a silver egg.
A Bucket Helmet. It provides a level of regional protection from inflicted damage.
A building plan. You can use this to craft buildings - right click when equipped for more options.
Bunny Ears. Grants additional Egg Vision allowing you to detect more eggs during an Easter egg hunt.
A silly Bunny Hat with wobbly ears to celebrate Easter 2021
A Bunny Onesie. Grants additional Egg Vision allowing you to detect more eggs during an Easter egg hunt.
Basic burlap gloves, offering protection from the elements
A Headwrap made out of burlap.
A Shirt made out of burlap.
Shoes made out of burlap.
Trousers made out of burlap.
Bear Meat that has been overcooked.
Burned chicken. Eating it will damage your health.
Burned Deer Meat. Eating it will damage your health.
Burned horse meat. Eating it will damage your health.
Burned Meat from a human being. Consuming will damage your health.
This little piggy has been in the oven for too long.
Spoiled Wolf Meat. Consuming will damage your health.
A weapon attachment that modifies recoil and rate of fire. Allows weapon to fire in 3 round bursts when turned on. Use [+firemode] to toggle on or off.
A sharp butcher knife. Extremely good at harvesting flesh from both dead or alive bodies.
A simple electric button.
Allows you to pass a cable through a wall. Each input will forward the amount it receives to the corresponding output on the other side.
Flesh of a Cactus, contains water.
A camera. Take screenshots with primary fire, zoom in and out with secondary fire, and lock focus with third fire.
Dual module camper that allows up to 4 players to respawn. Also includes a barbecue, a locker and a small box for item storage.
A small camp fire. Provides warmth and light, and you can cook with it.
A selection of crumpled cans assembled into a ring to produce some great background percussion.
A hat with a candle on top. You can turn the candle on in your inventory.
A very old candy cane from 2014
Smash some faces with this large piece of candy
Beans found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
Chunked tuna found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
A deteriorating piece of paper with information relating to the last moments of this vessel.
A fake moustache for Movember
A table for playing card games
A key to a car, created at a vehicle lift. Keep this item safe; if lost you'll be unable to drive the car again!
A small radio to use in cars. Will only work while the car is turned on.
A pumpkin that you can carve. Requires wood as a fuel source.
A tape that you can record audio on to using a Cassette Recorder. Stores up to 30s of audio.
A tape that you can record audio on to using a Cassette Recorder. Stores up to 20s of audio.
Insert a cassette and play the recorded audio with [attack], [attack2] to record new audio and [+reload] to throw.
A tape that you can record audio on to using a Cassette Recorder. Stores up to 10s of audio.
An improvised catapult siege weapon. Built for flinging destructive projectiles with questionable accuracy. Can be towed by horses.
A large, whiskered fresh water based predator. Eats everything, so you never know what you'll find in it's stomach.
A CCTV Camera system can be used for realtime surveillance and security around your base when powered and paired with the Computer Station.
A small ceiling mounted light source.
A Chainlink Fence.
A Chainlink Fence Gate.
A Chainsaw. Very effective at cutting trees in addition to soft fleshy objects. Requires Low Grade Fuel to run.
Every home needs a chair. A decorative item which provides comfort while seated.
A very large mortar type firework with an massive champagne colored explosion followed by smaller orange starbursts
Byproduct from campfires and furnaces used for crafting gunpowder.
An enclosure to keep some chickens around. Chickens with plenty of food, water and sunlight produce more eggs.
An inflatable chicken costume. Acting as a replacement for wooden pants, you can equip this item to look as silly as possible.
Just like mom used to make. Provides a boost to hunger, health and hydration. Increases the chance of better genes from crops for short time.
A decorative Paper lantern
A decorative White Paper lantern
An Arcade Machine
Chocolate Bar found as loot. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
Get into the christmas spirit with this holiday door wreath.
A string of colored lights to decorate your home
Get into the holiday spirit with this decorative Christmas tree
A table for managing clans.
Special helmet for players who own Clatter and have played for at least 30 minutes, replaces the bucket helmet.
Cloth from an animal or a Hemp Bush. Used in many clothing items, weapons, and more.
Crappy Holidays!
Single module cockpit for a driver and one passenger.
Single module cockpit for a driver and one passenger, with a small engine.
A shoddy piece of body armor made from coconut and plants, provides some basic protection from melee and ranged attacks.
Hand protection made of bark and plants, offers some protection to the upper body.
A shoddy helmet made from coconut, provides some basic protection from melee and ranged attacks.
A shoddy piece of leg armor made from coconut and plants, provides some basic protection from melee and ranged attacks.
An electronic lock. Locked and unlocked with four-digit code.
A Coffee Can Helmet. It provides a level of regional protection from inflicted damage.
An old wooden coffin, can store up to 42 items
Combat knife designed for close combat engagements, can attack while sprinting. Best in class at harvesting flesh.
A block that runs commands
Produces fertilizer from compostable items.
A very powerful bow. Can only be fully drawn while stationary. Keep still for bonus damage and speed.
A Computer station for remote control access
A barricade made out of Stones.
A salvaged piece of concrete and rebar which can be used to harvest wood
A salvaged piece of concrete and rebar with a sharp edge. Can be used to harvest Stone, Metal ore and Sulfur ore.
Blast a cloud of birthday themed confetti cheer.
A small speaker that will play any audio from a connected Boom Box.
Delicious Bear Meat, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Delicious Big Cat Meat, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Cooked chicken. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Delicious Crocodile Meat, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Cooked Deer Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Cooked Fish. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
Cooked Horse Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Salty meat from a human being, eating this will restore some hunger and health but reduces hydration. Maybe you should look for a better food source.
Cooked pork, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Delicious Snake Meat, Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Cooked Wolf Meat. Eating it will restore some health, hunger, and thirst.
Used to cook advanced recipes for food, fuel, ammunition and explosives.
An ear of corn. Eating it provides a small boost to health, hunger, and thirst.
A Clipping of a Corn Plant.

Corn seeds can be found when picking wild Corn plants. These seeds can be planted in the ground and grown to collect additional food. Planting these seeds in a planter, and then watering them with large quantities of water yields significantly more corn and faster growth.
A basic cathode ray tube screen combined with an incremental counter. Can display power received, or can count upwards and allow passthrough when a target is reached.
A road sign that's been repurposed to produce some beautiful, calming, percussion.
A sneaky crate costume. Use with a friend to expertly troll other players
A pie made from crocodile meat, may cause a reptile dysfunction. Boosts hunger, health and hydration. Gives better night vision, including tree markings and ore hotspots, for a short time.
A very accurate ranged weapon.
Raw Oil out of the ground, must be refined in a refinery to be used.
Cultist Deer Torch
A spooky cast iron cauldron with a green goo.
A rapid-firing Machine Gun. Sacrifices accuracy and distance for speed.
